info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 7:42PM PDT until September 27 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, a small portion of far east-central Los Angeles. This includes much of the Bridge Burn Scar.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Minor debris flows, rockslides, and mudslides.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 PM PDT, light showers continue across the advisory area, which could prolong and flood, debris flow, rockslide, and mudslide impacts from earlier heavy showers and thunderstorms. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Big Pines, Angeles Crest Highway between Mount Waterman and the San Bernardino County line, as well as Highway 138 between Llano and the San Bernardino County line... Much of the Bridge Burn Scar.
- Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING
